p: A new study is refining our knowledge of the symptoms caused by the COVID-19 epidemic, which affects the world's population. It also highlights the presence of aggravating factors in the most severe cases. When looking at critically ill patients, two prevalent illnesses appear to worsen COVID-19 infection. The first is hypertension, since 23.7% of patients in critical condition are suffering from it. In the second position comes diabetes, without a distinction of the type being made, which affects 16.2% of the most severe cases [ 30, 31].
